tit.e: "Se" (or 'Ho,' An Unit Of Square Measure Of Land)/"Une" (Ridges In A Field)
Se (畝; a unit of land area) or Une (畝; ridges in a field)
tit.cmt: 本項には異なる読み・内容が含まれるため、併記しました。
tit.e: Se (畝; a unit of land area) or Une (畝; ridges in a field)

sen.j: 畝
sen.e: "Se" (or 'ho')
Se or Une (畝)
Se or Une (畝)

sen.j: -- 土地の面積の単位。
sen.e: : An unit of square measure of land
A unit of land area.
A unit of land area.

sen.j: -- 畑で、作物を作るために（何本も間隔を空けて）細長く直線状に土を盛り上げた所のこと。
sen.e: : "Une" refers to ridges in a field, or rows of a long and narrow mound for cultivating agricultural products, running in parallel with a space in between.
: "Une" refers to ridges in a field, or rows of a long and narrow mound for cultivating agricultural products, running in parallel with a space in between.
: "Une" refers to ridges in a field, or rows of a long and narrow mound for cultivating agricultural products, running in parallel with a space in between.

sen.j: 英語ではenhillingまたはhillと呼ぶ。
sen.e: In English, it is also called "hilling," or "hill."
sen.cmt: （注）ネット上では"enhilling"ではなく"hilling"となっていますので、訳もこれによっています。
sen.e: In English, it is also called hilling or hill.
In English, it is also called hilling or hill.

sen.j: また道路や水面波が畝る（曲がる）などと動詞ともなる。
sen.e: In Japanese, "une" is verbalized into "uneru," which means, for example, "(a road) winds in and out" or "(a wave) surges."
sen.cmt: （注）ネット上では「水面波」ではなく「波」となっていますので、訳もこれによっています。
sen.e: In Japanese, une is verbalized into uneru, which means, (a road) to wind in and out or (a wave) to surge.
In Japanese, une is verbalized into uneru, which means, (a road) to wind in and out or (a wave) to surge.

sen.j: 単位としての畝
sen.e: "Se" (or 'ho') as an unit of square measure of land
Se (or ho) as a unit
Se (or ho) as a unit

sen.j: 畝（せ、ほ）は、尺貫法における土地の面積の単位である。
sen.e: "Se" (or 'ho') is an unit of square measure of land in East Asian system of weights and measures.
sen.cmt: （注）「尺貫法」は狭義では日本における度量衡の単位系を指し、広義では東アジア一帯で用いられる度量衡の単位系を指します。後列で「畝」が中国の単位をも含んでいることから、ここの「尺貫法」も広義に用いているように思われます。
sen.e: Se (or ho) is a unit of land area in East Asian system of weights and measures.
Se (or ho) is a unit of land area in East Asian system of weights and measures.

sen.j: 日本のものは「せ」、中国のものは「ほ」と読み、同じ字を使うがその値や成り立ちが異なり、全く別のものである。
sen.e: Though using the same Chinese character (畝), the Japanese unit and the Chinese unit are completely different - for example, in reading ("se" in Japanese, and "ho" in Chinese), in size, and in origin.
Though using the same Chinese character (畝), the Japanese unit and the Chinese unit are completely different in reading ('se' in Japanese and 'ho' in Chinese), in size, and in origin.
Though using the same Chinese character (畝), the Japanese unit and the Chinese unit are completely different in reading ('se' in Japanese and 'ho' in Chinese), in size, and in origin.

sen.j: どちらも畑の畝（うね）に由来するものと考えられる。
sen.e: But both of them seem to have originated from "une" in a field.
But both of them seem to have originated from une in a field.
But both of them seem to have originated from une in a field.

sen.j: 日本の畝（せ）は単純に坪（坪）の倍量単位となっており、30歩のことを指す。
sen.e: "Se" as the Japanese unit simply has a larger scale than "tsubo" (also called 'bu') and 1 se is equal to 30 bu.
sen.cmt: （注）ネット上では括弧内は「歩」となっていますので、訳でもこれによっています。
sen.e: Se as the Japanese unit is simply a unit of multiples of tsubo (bu) and 1 se is equal to 30 bu.
Se as the Japanese unit is simply a unit of multiples of tsubo (bu) and 1 se is equal to 30 bu.

sen.j: 10畝を1反（段）とする。
sen.e: And 10 se is equal to 1 "tan."
And 10 se is equal to 1 tan (a unit).
And 10 se is equal to 1 tan (a unit).

sen.j: 明治時代に1尺＝(10/33)メートルと定められたので、1歩＝約3.305785平方メートルとなり、1畝＝約99.174平方メートルとなる。
sen.e: In the Meiji period, 1 "shaku" (a Japanese unit of length) was set at 10/33 meter, so 1 bu, calculated by multiplying 6 shaku by 6 shaku, was roughly equal to 3.305785 square meters, so 1 se became about 99.174 square meters.
sen.cmt: （注）原文1行目の「1歩」の前には内容的に言って「6尺ｘ6尺で算出される」と補われるべきと解されます。
sen.e: In the Meiji period, 1 shaku (a Japanese unit of length) was set at 10 over 33 meter, so 1 bu (calculated by multiplying 6 shaku by 6 shaku) was roughly equal to 3.305785 square meters, so 1 se became about 99.174 square meters.

In the Meiji period, 1 shaku (a Japanese unit of length) was set at 10 over 33 meter, so 1 bu (calculated by multiplying 6 shaku by 6 shaku) was roughly equal to 3.305785 square meters, so 1 se became about 99.174 square meters.

sen.j: この値は1アール＝100平方メートルに非常に近く、畝からメートル法のアールへの移行はスムーズに行われた。
sen.e: This figure is quite close to 1 are [unit] (= 100 square meters), so the switch of se into are [unit] of the metric system was quite smooth.
This figure is quite close to 1 are (a unit) equivalent to 100 square meters, so the switch of se into are (unit) of the metric system was quite smooth.
This figure is quite close to 1 are (a unit) equivalent to 100 square meters, so the switch of se into are (unit) of the metric system was quite smooth.

sen.j: 中国の畝（ほ、ムー）は、古くは10歩 (尺貫法)四方（この歩は長さの単位で6尺のこと）の面積すなわち100平方歩（3600平方尺）のことを指した。
sen.e: "Ho" ('mu' in pinyin) as the Chinese unit was in ancient times the square measure of the area that had sides of 10 "bu" - here, bu is an unit of length, and 1 bu is 6 shaku - or 100 square meters (3600 square "shaku" ['chi' in pinyin]).

Se (ho or mu in pinyin) as the Chinese unit was in ancient times the square measure of the area that had sides of 10 bu (here, bu is a unit of length, and 1 bu is 6 shaku) or 100 square meters (3600 square shaku ['chi' in pinyin]).

Se (ho or mu in pinyin) as the Chinese unit was in ancient times the square measure of the area that had sides of 10 bu (here, bu is a unit of length, and 1 bu is 6 shaku) or 100 square meters (3600 square shaku ['chi' in pinyin]).

sen.j: 後に5尺四方の120倍とされた。
sen.e: Later, 1 ho was reset at 120 times the size of the area with sides of 5 shaku.
Later, 1 se was reset at 120 times the size of the area with sides of 5 shaku.
Later, 1 se was reset at 120 times the size of the area with sides of 5 shaku.

sen.j: 尺の長さ自体が時代によって異なるので畝の面積も異なるが、おおむね6アール程度であった。
sen.e: Though the square measure of 1 ho varied according as the length of 1 shaku itself varied from time to time, 1 se was roughly equal to 6 ares.
Although the square measure of 1 se varied according as the length of 1 shaku itself varied from time to time, 1 se was roughly equal to 6 ares.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: Although the square measure of 1 se varied according as the length of 1 shaku itself varied from time to time, 1 se was roughly equal to 6 ares.

sen.j: 現在の市制 (単位系)においては、1/15ヘクタール（約6.67アール）を1畝としている。
sen.e: In the present Chinese system of measurement, 1/15 hectare (about 6.67 are) is equalized with 1 畝 (reads as "ho").
In the present Chinese system of measurement, a 15th hectares (about 6.67 ares) is equalized with 1 se.
In the present Chinese system of measurement, a 15th hectares (about 6.67 ares) is equalized with 1 se.

sen.j: また、ヤード・ポンド法のエーカーにも畝の字を宛てており、区別のため、前者を市畝（市亩）、後者を英畝（英亩）という。
sen.e: The Chinese character 畝 is also applied to the unit of acre which is used in the yard-pound system, and so, to make a distinction, the unit of the Chinese system is called "shi mu" in pinyin and the unit of the yard-pound system is called "ying mu" in pinyin.

The Chinese character 畝 is also applied to the unit of acre which is used in the yard-pound system, and so, to make a distinction, the unit of the Chinese system is called shi mu in pinyin and the unit of the yard-pound system is called ying mu in pinyin.

The Chinese character 畝 is also applied to the unit of acre which is used in the yard-pound system, and so, to make a distinction, the unit of the Chinese system is called shi mu in pinyin and the unit of the yard-pound system is called ying mu in pinyin.

sen.j: 畑の畝
sen.e: Une in a field
Une in a field
Une in a field

sen.j: 畑の畝、畦（どちらも、うね）は、作物を生育させるために土を盛り上げた所。
sen.e: Une in a field is the mounds made for cultivating agricultural products.
Une in a field is the mounds made for cultivating agricultural products.
Une in a field is the mounds made for cultivating agricultural products.

sen.j: 畝はしばしば苗や作物を風からの障害を防ぐ目的がある。
sen.e: Mostly, the purpose of making une is to prevent seedlings and other agricultural products from withering owing to the wind.
Mostly, the purpose of making une is to prevent seedlings and other agricultural products from withering owing to the wind.
Mostly, the purpose of making une is to prevent seedlings and other agricultural products from withering owing to the wind.

sen.j: 畝はスコップや鍬、また機械の耕耘機やトラクターを用いて立てる。
sen.e: Une is made with a shovel, a hoe, a cultivator, or a tractor.
Une is made with a shovel, a hoe, a cultivator, or a tractor.
Une is made with a shovel, a hoe, a cultivator, or a tractor.

sen.j: 通常、作物を作り終え次の作物を生育するとき、畝を立て直す。
sen.e: Usually, une is remade when crops are reaped and the new ones are planted.
Usually, une is remade when crops are reaped and the new ones are planted.
Usually, une is remade when crops are reaped and the new ones are planted.

sen.j: これを畝換えと言う。
sen.e: This is called "une-gae" (remaking of une).
This is called une-gae (remaking of une).
This is called une-gae (remaking of une).

sen.j: 作物や土の状態によって、畝が必要でなかったり、畝の形状を変更したりする。
sen.e: Whether it is necessary to make une in the first place and how the une should be made depends on the kind of products and the condition of soil.
Whether it is necessary to make une in the first place and how the une should be made depends on the kind of products and the condition of soil.
Whether it is necessary to make une in the first place and how the une should be made depends on the kind of products and the condition of soil.

sen.j: 冬以外の気候ならば南北方向に立てられる。
sen.e: When the products are grown other than winter, une is made from south and to north.
When the products are grown other than winter, une is made from south and to north.
When the products are grown other than winter, une is made from south and to north.

sen.j: 温度も十分で土を温める必要もないからである。
sen.e: For, the temperature is high enough and there is no need to warm the soil.
The temperature is high enough and there is no need to warm the soil.
The temperature is high enough and there is no need to warm the soil.

sen.j: しかし、冬の天候では土が十分温まらないこともあり、光が当たる面積を増やす目的で畝が東西に立てられる。
sen.e: But in winter, the sunshine alone is sometimes not enough to warm up the soil, so une is made from east to west so that the soil can bask in the long sunshine.
But in winter, the sunshine alone is sometimes not enough to warm up the soil, so une is made from east to west so that the soil can bask in the long sunshine.
But in winter, the sunshine alone is sometimes not enough to warm up the soil, so une is made from east to west so that the soil can bask in the long sunshine.

sen.j: よく畝を立てるとされる状況は、以下のような場合である。
sen.e: Une is often made in the following cases :
Une is often made in the following cases.
Une is often made in the following cases.

sen.j: 土の水はけが悪い場合
sen.e: the case that the soil is poorly drainded;
The case that the soil is poorly drained
The case that the soil is poorly drained

sen.j: 作物が塊根、塊茎である場合（ジャガイモなど）
sen.e: the case that the product has a root tuber, or a tuber (such as potato);
The case that the product has a root tuber, or a tuber (such as potato)
The case that the product has a root tuber, or a tuber (such as potato)

sen.j: 強力な茎をもつ作物を生育する場合（リーキなど）
sen.e: the case that a product with a strong stem is grown (such as leek);
The case that a product with a strong stem is grown (such as leek)
The case that a product with a strong stem is grown (such as leek)

sen.j: その他の場合（チコリーなど）
sen.e: the case that a chicory (or other products) are grown
The case that other products (such as chicory) are grown
The case that other products (such as chicory) are grown

sen.j: 例として、畝をよく用いられる作物にジャガイモがある。
sen.e: Among others, potato is the typical agricultural product which is grown in une.
Among others, potato is the typical agricultural product which is grown in une.
Among others, potato is the typical agricultural product which is grown in une.

sen.j: ジャガイモの塊茎は地面の下に成長するが、これが光を受けた場合クロロフィルとソラニンを生成する。
sen.e: A tuber of potato grows under ground, and when it is exposed to the sunshine, it produces chlorophyll and solanine.
A tuber of potato grows underground, and when it is exposed to the sunshine, it produces chlorophyll and solanine.
A tuber of potato grows underground, and when it is exposed to the sunshine, it produces chlorophyll and solanine.

sen.j: ソラニンは非常に有害で、吐き気や頭痛、重篤な場合だと死に至る。
sen.e: Solanine is so harmful to the human body as to cause you nausea, a headache, and in a serious case, death.
Solanine is as harmful to the human body as to cause you nausea, a headache, and in a serious case, death.
Solanine is as harmful to the human body as to cause you nausea, a headache, and in a serious case, death.

sen.j: したがって、ジャガイモの成長期は畝を立て（土をかぶせ）、廃棄することがないようにしている。
sen.e: Therefore, when potato is in the growth period, une is made - in other words, the tuber is covered with soil - not to let solanine out of soil.
Therefore, when potato is in the growth period, une is made; in other words, the tuber is covered with soil, not to be discarded.
Therefore, when potato is in the growth period, une is made; in other words, the tuber is covered with soil, not to be discarded.

sen.j: 畝の形状
sen.e: Shape of une
Shape of une
Shape of une

sen.j: 畝の形状は、山型と台型がある。
sen.e: There are two types of une in shape, the mountain type and the plateau type.
There are two types of une in shape, the mountain type and the plateau type.
There are two types of une in shape, the mountain type and the plateau type.

sen.j: 山型は断面を見ると山のように盛り上げて形成する。
sen.e: The mountain type is made by heaping up earth like a mountain.
The mountain type is made by heaping up earth like a mountain.
The mountain type is made by heaping up earth like a mountain.

sen.j: 山の頂上は平たくする。
sen.e: The mountaintop is flattened out.
The mountaintop is flattened out.
The mountaintop is flattened out.

sen.j: 台型のように平たくないため、根菜類などの作物などの山型にすることで掘り起こすことが容易になるものに適用される。
sen.e: The flattened area is not so wide as the plateau type, so this mountain type is applied to the root crops and the like, which are easy to dig up for the shape of une.
The flattened area is not so wide as the plateau type, so this mountain type is applied to the root crops and the like, which are easy to dig up for the shape of une.
The flattened area is not so wide as the plateau type, so this mountain type is applied to the root crops and the like, which are easy to dig up for the shape of une.

sen.j: 作物が生育するに従って土が崩れ落ちてくるため畝を直さなければならない場合がある。
sen.e: Occasionally, une should be remade if soil crumbles as the product grows.
Occasionally, une should be remade if soil crumbles as the product grows.
Occasionally, une should be remade if soil crumbles as the product grows.

sen.j: 一方、台型は全体を台に盛り上げて畝を形成する。
sen.e: On the other hand, the plateau type is made by heaping up earth in the shape of a plateau.
Meanwhile, the plateau type is made by heaping up earth in the shape of a plateau.
Meanwhile, the plateau type is made by heaping up earth in the shape of a plateau.

sen.j: 山型のように側がないため、根菜類は掘り起こさなければならない。
sen.e: This type has no side slope, so it is not easy to dig up the root crops.
sen.cmt: （注）原文の「掘り起こさなければならない」は、台型との対比からも、「掘り起こすのは容易ではない」の意味に解しています。
sen.e: This type has no side slope, so it is not easy to dig up the root crops.
This type has no side slope, so it is not easy to dig up the root crops.
